html:
“Die With a Smile” collaborators Gaga and Mars will perform a tribute to Los Angeles on Sunday, February 2

Shaboozey, Lady Gaga, and Bruno Mars have joined the slate of performers for the 2025 Grammy Awards, which air this Sunday, February 2. Billie Eilish, Charli XCX, Chappell Roan, Doechii, Sabrina Carpenter and more are also set to play the Trevor Noah-hosted ceremony, which will be held at Los Angeles’ Crypto.com Arena and raise funds for relief efforts in the wake of the California wildfires.

According to the Recording Academy’s Instagram, Gaga and Mars will appear as a duo to “perform a special tribute to the city of Los Angeles and those affected by the wildfires.” Their collaborative single “Die With a Smile” is nominated for Song and Record of the Year. After tying the record for most weeks spent at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 with “A Bar Song (Tipsy),” Shaboozey is up for five awards, including Best New Artist, Song of the Year, and Best Country Song.

Read “Grammys 2025 Predictions: Who Will Win and Who Should Win?” on The Pitch, and follow along with all of Pitchfork’s coverage of the ceremony this Sunday.
